p: A perfect congruency for viral detection was observed in 25 paired-samples (83%), including 13 paired virus-positive and 12 virus-negative samples . The Kappa index, κ=0.67 [95%CI: 0.40; 0.93] indicated a substantial concordance for viral molecular diagnosis between sputum and NP samples, arguing for equivalence between the two types of sampling methods. Furthermore, there was no discordance regarding the identification of the virus type ( Table 2).
